page.title: 03The Moor Hospital (C)
page.content: The Moor Hospital is the largest of the five local hospitals with 1200 beds.The hospital estate occupies 120 acres and is situated 1 mile east of Lancaster.It is mainly concerned with the treatment and care of the mentally ill;providing services for a wide area including Lancaster,Morecambe,Barrow,S.Lakeland & N.Yorkshire.Accommodation comprises an acute Unit,Long Stay areas,Garnet Clinic and a Geriatric Unit.The last two serve the local catchment area and the hospital has two sub-regional speciality units for Alcaholism and Child Psychiatry.In addition to the hospital facilities,many District departments are based on the site: Dist.Administration,Finance,Personnel, Linen Services & Works Dept.,together with Central Sterile Supplies,the School of Radiography and a Branch of the Regional Blood Transfusion Service.
